frameDefinitions: This frame describes the process that involves the inquiry and determination by an authority, the Investigator, of the circumstances surrounding an Incident perpetrated by a Suspect.
A Complainer communicates their negative emotional reaction to some state of affairs in a Complaint to an Addressee.
The words in this frame involve an Undesirable_event which affects the Patient negatively.
The words in this frame have to do with a Speaker asking an Addressee a question which calls for a reply (as opposed to making a request which calls for an action on the part of the Addressee).  ''
A person, the Cognizer, thinks about a Topic over a period of time.
This frame involves Buyers paying Money for Goods.
frameExamples: The police are <t>investigating</t> the bank's reported loss of several thousand dollars from their downtown branch's top security vault. DNI
The top US commander in Iraq <t>complained</t> to the Pentagon last winter that his supply situation was so poor that it threatened Army troops' ability to fight.
The first <t>calamity</t> was a disastrous trade war with Holland.
We <t>asked</t> Ruby what kind of food they ate.
The men were silently <t>mulling</t> <t>over</t> the proposition of committing an assassination
I <t>paid</t> her $50 for a video game.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Investigator</fen> is the person or agency that investigates the <fen>Suspect</fen> of a crime (<fen>Incident</fen>).

The <fen>Investigator</fen> attempts to determine the exact circumstances surrounding the <fen>Incident</fen>, which is typically a criminal act (murder, robbery) or the result of such an act (death, loss of money).
This role denotes the <fen>Suspect</fen> that is investigated by the <fen>Investigator</fen>.
When the <fen>Investigator</fen> investigates the <fen>Incident</fen>.
The <fen>Complainer</fen> is the sentient entity that produces the <fen>Complaint</fen> (whether spoken or written).
The lamentable situation that the <fen>Complainer</fen> is communicating to the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Complaint</fen> pertains.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Complainer</fen> to transmit the <fen>Complaint</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the complaint is made.
This role specifies the location where the complaining takes place.
The undesirable event which occurs.
The entity that experiences the <fen>Undesirable_Event</fen>.
When the <fen>Undesirable_Event</fen> occurs.
Where the <fen>Undesirable_Event</fen> takes place.
The person asking a question generally occurs as the External Argument of verb and noun targets:

The Addressee is most frequently the NP Object of a target verb.  However, with the verb <ment>inquire</ment>, Addressee can only occur as an <ment>of</ment>-PP and with a noun target, Addressee occurs in a PP Complement or as a possessive :
The Message, or content of the question, usually takes the form of a direct quote or an embedded question with a verb target:
Topic occurs very frequently in this frame with both noun and verb targets. It generally occurs as a PP Complement:
The time at which the questioning occurs.
With a target verb, the Cognizer is usually expressed as an External Argument, with the Topic appearing as an Object NP, a gerundive verbal Complement, or a PP.
With a target verb, the <fen>Topic</fen> is usually expressed as an Object NP, a gerundive verbal complement, or a PP.
The time at which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> considers the <fen>Topic</fen>.
The <fen>Buyer</fen> has the <fen>Money</fen> and wants the <fen>Goods</fen>.
The role <fen>Goods</fen> is anything (including labor or time, for example) which is exchanged for <fen>Money</fen> in a transaction.
<fen>Money</fen> is the thing given in exchange for <fen>Goods</fen> in a transaction.
In some cases, price or payment is described per unit of <fen>Goods</fen>.
The <fen>Seller</fen> has the <fen>Goods</fen> and wants the <fen>Money</fen>.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
listRoleExamples: The police are investigating <fex>Dr. Phil</fex>.
Our guys are <fex>currently</fex> investigating her disappearance.

<fex>Peter</fex> has moaned about it on another thread but it sure must be nice for him to wallow
again.
One observer groused <fex>that Skagway was 'little better than hell on earth.'</fex>
Ferdinand attended the reception at the city hall and complained vociferously <fex>about his reception at the city</fex>.
I don't mean to discount any of what he has bitched about <fex>in his article</fex>, because most of his points are actually valid.
Now <fex>yesterday</fex> I pissed and moaned about Rolling Stone magazines choice for the number 1 song of all time.
Guest Relations actually refunded the full eighty-five dollar price of the event to many event attendees who complained <fex>at City Hall</fex>.
An <fex>environmental</fex> disaster is just what we need.
<fex>Pat</fex> quizzed me about where I had been.
Pat questioned <fex>me</fex> about where I had been.
<fex>'What are you doing?'</fex> Kim inquired.
Pat inquired <fex>about train times</fex>.
I inquired <fex>yesterday</fex>.
<fex>Pat</fex> considered a career change.
Pat considered <fex>a career change</fex>.
<fex>Gem</fex> paid fifty dollars for a shirt
Kim paid fifty dollars <fex>for the shirt</fex>
Pat paid <fex>14 dollars</fex> for a movie ticket.
The manager pays the paper boys <fex>five dollars an hour</fex>.
<fex>The landlord</fex> is paid  $700 a month by the tenants for the apartment.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: one day in the autumn of 1955
